Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
docs: create comprehensive Warren project documentation

- Add Product Requirements Document (specs/prd.md)
  - Define Warren as simple-yet-powerful orchestrator for edge
  - Target: Swarm simplicity + K8s features - K8s complexity
  - Single binary < 100MB, zero external dependencies
  - Edge-first design with partition tolerance

- Add Technical Specification (specs/tech.md)
  - Go + Raft + containerd + WireGuard architecture
  - Manager-worker distributed system design
  - Detailed component design (scheduler, reconciler, networking)
  - Security model (mTLS, secrets encryption)
  - Deployment strategies (rolling, blue/green, canary)

- Add Milestone Plan (tasks/todo.md)
  - 6 milestones from Foundation to Open Source
  - Milestone 0: POCs (Raft, containerd, WireGuard)
  - Milestone 1-4: Core features, HA, deployment, observability
  - Milestone 5: Public release and community building

- Update Project Architecture (.agent/System/project-architecture.md)
  - Replace template with Warren-specific architecture
  - Document tech stack, components, data models
  - Define APIs, CLI, integration points
  - Include performance targets and testing strategy

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="Claude" GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL="noreply@anthropic.com" GIT_COMMITTER_NAME="Claude" GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL="noreply@anthropic.com" git commit -m "docs: add comprehensive E2E validation and performance benchmarking guides

Phase 1 Week 3 - Validation & Performance Documentation

Create detailed guides for end-to-end validation and performance
benchmarking to ensure Warren v1.1.0 is production-ready.

**E2E Validation Guide** (docs/e2e-validation.md):
- Complete deployment steps (3 managers + 3 workers)
- 8-phase validation checklist:
  1. Cluster Health
  2. Service Deployment
  3. Scaling Operations
  4. Leader Failover
  5. Secrets Management
  6. Volumes
  7. Built-in Ingress
  8. Health Monitoring
- 3 comprehensive test scenarios:
  - Basic service deployment
  - Rolling updates
  - Load testing
- Performance verification procedures
- Health & monitoring checks
- Troubleshooting guide
- Success criteria for production readiness

**Performance Benchmarking Guide** (docs/performance-benchmarking.md):
- Performance targets (latency, throughput, resources)
- 5 core metrics with benchmarking scripts:
  - Service creation latency (target: <500ms)
  - Task scheduling latency (target: <100ms/task)
  - API request latency (target: <50ms p50)
  - Raft performance (target: >10 ops/sec)
  - Reconciliation performance (target: <5s/cycle)
- 4 benchmark scenarios:
  - Baseline performance
  - Sustained load (100 tasks)
  - Burst load (50 services)
  - Failover performance
- Performance analysis tools
- Optimization tips
- Performance reporting templates

**Coverage**:
- 850+ lines of comprehensive documentation
- Ready-to-use bash scripts for benchmarking
- Clear success criteria
- Production-ready validation procedures

**Benefits**:
- Systematic validation process
- Performance baseline establishment
- Identify bottlenecks before production
- Reproducible benchmarking
- Operational readiness verification

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>")
